item.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Will Plead Guilty To Criminal Charges Next Week?
item.dc:creator: Foxy
item.description: Key Points: Sam Bankman-Fried will give his plea next week on criminal charges he defrauded investors and robbed customers of billions of dollars of money at its failed crypto exchange FTX, according to Reuters. The fallen FTX co-founder and former chief executive officer is expected to be charged on the afternoon of January 3, 2023, […]
item.content:encoded:
Key Points:

  • Sam Bankman-Fried will give his defense of the charges next week
  • The indictment is scheduled to take place on the afternoon of January 3, 2023.
  • SBF was at a disadvantage when two accomplices made confessions. If convicted, he faces decades in prison. FTX will also become the biggest scam in crypto history.
Sam Bankman-Fried will give his plea next week on criminal charges he defrauded investors and robbed customers of billions of dollars of money at its failed crypto exchange FTX, according to Reuters.

The fallen FTX co-founder and former chief executive officer is expected to be charged on the afternoon of January 3, 2023, according to Court filings dated December 28, 2023. U.S. District Attorney Lewis Kaplan in Manhattan federal court.

As mentioned in an earlier Coincu News article, Kaplan was assigned to join the case on Tuesday, after the judge initially withdrew himself because her husband’s law firm had advised FTX before it fall.

Prosecutors have accused Bankman-Fried of conspiring and planning the largest scam in crypto history. It’s been done over the years using customer deposits to support his hedge fund company Alameda Research, buy real estate, and infiltrate political circles.

Bankman-Fried was charged with two counts of wire fraud and six counts of conspiracy, including money laundering and campaign finance violations, and could face decades in prison if convicted.

Before his arrest on December 12, Bankman-Fried admitted to risk management failures at FTX, but adamantly protested that he did not participate in fraudulent activities and would not be held criminally responsible.

However, two of his close associates, former Alameda chief executive Caroline Ellison and former FTX chief technology officer, Gary Wang, pleaded guilty to their role in FTX’s collapse and agreed to cooperation with prosecutors is a major threat to the SBF’s previous denials.”

Bankman-Fried was released on December 22 with a $250 million bond and mortgaged by his parents’ home in Palo Alto, California, where they taught at Stanford Law School.

He is the subject of electronic surveillance. However, since the time of release, the e-wallets related to FTX and Alameda have been continuously active and the destination of these funds is the cryptocurrency mixer, which hackers use to erase traces, worried the community and raised questions about whether he was being eased from probation.

FTX filed for bankruptcy protection on November 11, its new CEO, John Ray, told Congress on December 13 that the exchange had lost $8 billion in customer funds. while being run by “completely inexperienced, unsophisticated individuals.”

item.title: Nouns Ethereum NFTs Will Appear In The 2023 Rose Parade
item.dc:creator: Annie
item.description: Key Points: The Nouns NFT concept has already been featured in an independent movie and a Super Bowl commercial. The Nouns DAO then approved and sponsored a proposal to see the pixel characters and their boxy spectacles (or Noggles) march in the Rose Parade the following week. Six costumed characters and a float with a […]
item.content:encoded:
Key Points:

  • The Nouns NFT concept has already been featured in an independent movie and a Super Bowl commercial.
  • Owners of Nouns can vote on proposals to use the treasury, which currently has about $32.7 million worth of ETH, to fund initiatives that further the project’s goal of creating open-source IP.
  • DAO, or decentralized autonomous organization, is an online group of people who come together for a common cause. Membership is often demonstrated by holding blockchain tokens.
The Nouns NFT concept has already been featured in an independent movie and a Super Bowl commercial. The Nouns DAO then approved and sponsored a proposal to see the pixel characters and their boxy spectacles (or Noggles) march in the Rose Parade the following week.

Six costumed characters and a float with a Nouns theme will participate in the 134th Rose Parade in Pasadena, California, on January 2, 2023. The parade occurs before the Penn State-Utah college football game at the Rose Bowl.

Stoopid The concept was offered to the Nouns community of NFT holders in April by Buddy Stoodios, the production firm for the TV shows “Robot Chicken” and “Marvel’s M.O.D.O.K.” The NFT enthusiast and co-founder of the studio proposed making the parade float and costumes and shooting the entire event for a documentary.

A novel Ethereum-based enterprise called Nouns sells off a single NFT pixel character daily, with all proceeds going into a communal fund. Owners of Nouns can vote on proposals to use the treasury, which currently has about $32.7 million worth of ETH, to fund initiatives that further the project’s goal of creating open-source IP.

As previously mentioned, the Nouns glasses were featured on limited-edition Bud Light cans and in a Bud Light Super Bowl commercial. The independent film “Calladita” will also feature Nouns, and the DAO has supported projects like physical Noggles, Web3 education programs, and a showing at New York Fashion Week.

In this instance, the DAO granted Stoopid Buddy Stoodios’ request for roughly 610 ETH to support the production of the parade float, costumes, and movie in June. When the application was approved on June 1, the investment had a value of over $1.1 million, even though 610 ETH now only has a value of roughly $723,000 due to Ethereum’s dropping value.

A DAO, or decentralized autonomous organization, is an online group of people who come together for a common cause. Membership is often demonstrated by holding blockchain tokens. Ownership of one of the NFTs is required to participate in the Nouns DAO in this scenario, and holders are given one vote per NFT on community proposals.

DISCLAIMER: The Information on this website is provided as general market commentary and does not constitute investment advice. We encourage you to do your research before investing.

item.title: DFPI Warns Of 16 Crypto Websites Suspected Of Fraud
item.dc:creator: Thana
item.description: Key Words: Over the course of two days, the California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation (DFPI) has issued 17 different warnings to cryptocurrency brokers and websites it believes to be fraudulent. The suspected crypto websites include: Wherein, eth-Wintermute.net, and UniSwap LLC are the two copycat sites posing as two big names in the crypto […]
item.content:encoded:
Key Words:

  • The DFPI’s consumer alert page now has 16 alerts from December 27 to 28 warning businesses to appear to be involved in fraud against California consumers.
  • The warnings were issued in response to public complaints about the brokers and websites, noting that consumers have losses ranging from $2,000 to $1.2 million.
Over the course of two days, the California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation (DFPI) has issued 17 different warnings to cryptocurrency brokers and websites it believes to be fraudulent.

The suspected crypto websites include:

  1. Tahoe Digital Exchange
  2. TeleTrade Options
  3. Tony Alin Trading Firm
  4. Hekamenltd/Tosal Markets Limited
  5. Trade 1960
  6. Yong Ying Global Investment Company Limited
  7. Unison FX
  8. VoyanX.com
  9. rbhoodc.com
  10. Rui Win Capital Group LTD
  11. Reliable Option Trade
  12. Singapore International Monetary Exchange Limited/ Simex
  13. Sun Bit Proa
  14. UniSwap LLC
  15. eth-Wintermute.net
  16. ZC Exchange

Wherein, eth-Wintermute.net, and UniSwap LLC are the two copycat sites posing as two big names in the crypto sector.

The DFPI’s consumer alert page now has 16 alerts from December 27 to 28 warning that these businesses appear to be involved in fraud against California consumers.

It is unusual for the DFPI to issue so many notifications at once, implying that the amount of crypto fraud reports may have increased in the final parts of the year. The DFPI normally issues intermittent warnings concerning company investigations or notices about specific instances.

The warnings were issued in response to public complaints about the brokers and websites, with the DFPI noting that consumers have reported losses ranging from $2,000 to $1.2 million in certain cases. The DFPI, on the other hand, just states that these websites “appears to be engaged in fraud.”

A significant theme asserted in the majority of these advisories is pig slaughtering schemes, in which an individual or group creates a phony identity online in order to cultivate fraudulent relationships or friendships via social media, texting, and dating apps.

The ultimate objective is to convince the victim to invest in cryptocurrency through a spoof version of a real website, in this case, UniSwap LLC and eth-Wintermute.net or by sending cash to a shady wallet address.

item.title: Will PancakeSwap’s Recent Popularity Affect CAKE In The Future?
item.dc:creator: Annie
item.description: Key Points: PancakeSwap [CAKE] announced that Primal, an athlete-fan token initiative, would begin working with its syrup pool farm on December 28. Thanks to this new feature, users will now be able to bet CAKE to earn PRIMAL. The farm will give out 0.2x CAKE awards for the first 48 hours, then 0.1x rewards. For […]
item.content:encoded:
Key Points:

  • PancakeSwap [CAKE] announced that Primal, an athlete-fan token initiative, would begin working with its syrup pool farm on December 28.
  • The network’s burn rate for PancakeSwap seems to be somewhat optimistic, given that it recently burned 6,808,702 tokens worth more than $22 million.
  • The network’s burn rate for PancakeSwap seems to be somewhat optimistic, given that it recently burned 6,808,702 tokens worth more than $22 million.
PancakeSwap [CAKE] announced that Primal, an athlete-fan token initiative, would begin working with its syrup pool farm on December 28. Thanks to this new feature, users will now be able to bet CAKE to earn PRIMAL.

The farm will give out 0.2x CAKE awards for the first 48 hours, then 0.1x rewards. For users to earn tokens while exercising, PRIMAL interfaces with activity trackers like Fitbit, Apple, Oura, and Whoop.

CAKE’s response to this upgrade was subpar, as is shown on its daily chart, which was highlighted in red. In the last seven days, the price of CAKE has decreased by more than 4,4%, according to CoinCu. Additionally, it had a market value of more than $522 million at the time of publication and was trading at $3.144.

Santiment’s research did, however, offer some solace since several on-chain metrics suggested that CAKE’s next price movement would soon be supported.

Over the past week, the token’s Market Value to Realized Value (MVRV) Ratio has decreased, which can be a sign that the market has reached a bottom. The velocity of CAKE also increased, which raises the possibility of a trend reversal even more.

Last week, CAKE’s social dominance frequently increased, demonstrating its appeal. Not only was CAKE’s social supremacy confirmed, but so was its appeal. This was because it had received the second-most mentions in the past 24 hours among the top BNB Chain initiatives.

The network’s burn rate for PancakeSwap seems to be somewhat optimistic, given that it recently burned 6,808,702 tokens worth more than $22 million.

Over the past week, the token’s Market Value to Realized Value (MVRV) Ratio has decreased, which can signify that the market has reached a bottom. The velocity of CAKE also increased, which raises the possibility of a trend reversal even more.

Last week, CAKE’s social dominance frequently increased, demonstrating its appeal. Not only was CAKE’s social supremacy confirmed, but so was its appeal. This was because it had received the second-most mentions in the past 24 hours among the top BNB Chain initiatives.

The network’s burn rate for PancakeSwap seems to be somewhat optimistic, given that it recently burned 6,808,702 tokens worth more than $22 million.

item.title: 3Commas Has Confirmed The API Leak
item.dc:creator: Thana
item.description: Key Points: 3Commas representative claimed the corporation had viewed the hacker’s message and verified the information in the uploaded files was accurate on Wednesday. Immediately, the crypto trading software provider announced to request Binance, Kucoin and other supported exchanges revoke all keys that were connected to 3Commas. Following the thread, the firm stated that only […]
item.content:encoded:
Key Points:

  • After new rumours on Twitter, Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao claimed he’s “reasonably sure” there were “wide spread API key leaks” from trading-bot platform 3Commas.
  • A representative for 3Commas said the business had viewed the hacker’s message and verified the information in the uploaded files was accurate after.
3Commas representative claimed the corporation had viewed the hacker’s message and verified the information in the uploaded files was accurate on Wednesday.

Immediately, the crypto trading software provider announced to request Binance, Kucoin and other supported exchanges revoke all keys that were connected to 3Commas.

Following the thread, the firm stated that only a small number of technical employees had access to the infrastructure, but the firm has taken steps to remove their access. Although saying that “it was always a possible scenario and on their watch list”, the trading software provider announced there has no evidence of an inside job.

Since then, we have implemented new security measures and will not stop there; we are launching a full investigation involving law enforcement.

Previously, Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao stated on Wednesday that he is reasonably sure there were wide spread API key leaks from trading-bot platform, following new social media speculation about an October event.

If you have ever put an API key in 3Commas (from any exchange), please disable it immediately.

CZ wrote

As Coincu reported, an investigation undertaken in October by 3Commas and the collapsed FTX crypto exchange found that API keys were used to make illicit transactions for DMG trading pairs. On October 20, the 3Commas team was notified of an issue in which FTX API keys associated with the platform were exploited to conduct unauthorized trades.

Through an investigation, the team said that they discovered multiple fake websites claiming to be 3Commas were used to phish information by tricking users into connecting their exchange accounts to fraudulent web interfaces, noting that third-party browser extensions or malware may have been involved.

item.title: Manchester United Accused Of Copying Artist DesLucrece NFTs
item.dc:creator: Thana
item.description: Key Points: A well-known NFT artist known for his vibrant animated monsters has been compared to an official collection from the Manchester United Football Club that appears a little too much like his work. A Twitter named ClownVamp criticized Manchester United for the similarities between its “The Devils” collection and the work of DesLucrece, the […]
item.content:encoded:
Key Points:

  • Manchester United’s NFT collection has been criticised for being too similar to the work of famous NFT artist DesLucrece.
  • DesLucrece stated that he, Tezos, and Manchester United are discussing a solution to the problem.
A well-known NFT artist known for his vibrant animated monsters has been compared to an official collection from the Manchester United Football Club that appears a little too much like his work.

A Twitter named ClownVamp criticized Manchester United for the similarities between its “The Devils” collection and the work of DesLucrece, the pseudonymous name of an NFT artist renowned for the Des Monsters collection, which presently has an OpenSea floor price of 17.5 ETH, or $20,825. A colour scheme, similar eyes, and horns are shared by virtually identical figures in a side-by-side comparison.

We need answers. This is total garbage.

Following the accusation, ClownVamp also claimed one of the DesLucrece signature traits that his monsters usually have O ring earrings also has been seen in the products from the Manchester United collection.

DesLucrece then stated on Twitter that he and Breitman are discussing a solution and are expecting a response from Manchester United. While noting that he wanted to protect art and artists on the Tezos platform.

I think the resolution here should be beneficial for everyone involved, Dinner with Ronaldo isn’t off the table.

On the following day, DesLucrece announced that correspondence between him and ManU had started. He had called the Manchester United team while saying that was probably the last update on this for a while since everyone is still on holiday.

In times of adversity, you’ll know who your friends are. Thank you, Tezos community.

DesLucrece wrote

Manchester United first collaborated with the Tezos Foundation earlier this year, and The Devils was published on December 21. The collection of 7,777 NFTs, each costing around $36, has since sold out.

item.title: Audit Platform CertiK Became An Official Partner Of The Open Network
item.dc:creator: Harold
item.description: Key Points: The audit platform CertiK has become an official partner of The Open Network (TON) and will audit TON-based smart contracts and services. With its analytics system, Skynet, CertiK monitors and analyzes smart contracts in real time and immediately alerts if any vulnerabilities are found. The partnership will increase security standards and transparency in […]
item.content:encoded:
Key Points:

  • CertiK has become an official partner of The Open Network and will audit TON-based smart contracts and services. With its analytics system, Skynet, CertiK monitors and analyzes smart contracts in real time and immediately alerts if any vulnerabilities are found.
  • CertiK has audited many key components of The Open Network, including the vesting schedule smart contract, TON Bridge application, and TON Baselayer.
  • The partnership with CertiK will increase security standards and transparency in the TON ecosystem while increasing confidence in the network for all participants.
The audit platform CertiK has become an official partner of The Open Network (TON) and will audit TON-based smart contracts and services.

With its analytics system, Skynet, CertiK monitors and analyzes smart contracts in real time and immediately alerts if any vulnerabilities are found. The partnership will increase security standards and transparency in the TON ecosystem while increasing confidence in the network for all participants.

CertiK has audited many key components of The Open Network, including the vesting schedule smart contract, TON Bridge application, and TON Baselayer. The company reduces the risk of Web3 services being compromised by security threats using a hands-on approach and automated audits run by artificial intelligence.

In order to give the network an additional layer of security assurance, the audit company also used formal verification. A defense-in-depth strategy is created by combining expert manual review with automated, AI-powered verification, which reduces and guards against the very real hazards that are present in the Web3 environment.

The Open Network is a layer-1 blockchain that is scalable, shardable, and enables fast, low-cost, and energy-efficient blockchain transactions. Every feature has been designed with the everyday user in mind.

TON has three bridges, one on Ethereum, the other on BSC, and Orbit Bridge. TON is the network’s native cryptocurrency and is used to pay for executing smart contracts, using dApps, and participating in governance. TON is currently live with 240 validators (as of December 1, 2022) and 1.4 million addresses on the network.

TON has attracted a lot of attention and is growing despite market volatility. The open-source protocol is one of the few ecosystems remaining alive after the events of FTX.

item.title: SignalPlus To Expand Offerings Through Deribit Integration
item.dc:creator: Harold
item.description: Key Points: SignalPlus, an encrypted asset options trading platform, announced the integration of Deribit encrypted currency derivatives transactions. Users can directly trade encrypted currency derivatives on the platform. Deribit users can also use SignalPlus to connect to their Deribit account API for transactions to use platform risk control, visualized data, and other functions. The connection […]
item.content:encoded:
Key Points:

  • Deribit encrypted currency derivatives transactions have been added to SignalPlus, an encrypted asset options trading platform.
  • On the platform, users can directly trade encrypted currency derivatives.
  • In order to access platform risk control, graphical data, and other features, Deribit users can now use SignalPlus to connect to their Deribit account API for transactions. Limited edition NFTs would be airdropped to early funders.
SignalPlus, an encrypted asset options trading platform, announced the integration of Deribit encrypted currency derivatives transactions. Users can directly trade encrypted currency derivatives on the platform.

Deribit users can also use SignalPlus to connect to their Deribit account API for transactions to use platform risk control, visualized data, and other functions.

The connection gives users access to a comprehensive range of professional trading services, including competitive pricing, volatility analytics, risk management, and direct trading access capabilities.

Additionally, with the trading platform embedded toolbox, users have unrestricted access to a rolodex of sophisticated modules, such as dynamic delta hedging, smart execution techniques, and a cutting-edge risk management system.

Chris Yu, co-founder & CEO of SignalPlus, said:

“We are very proud to expand upon our offerings and integrate Deribit, a premier digital derivatives exchange with advanced technology, a highly professional team, and a reputation for excellent depth and liquidity in the industry. With this integration, we believe that we can leverage the efficient trading tools offered by SignalPlus and jointly drive the growth of crypto options. We are excited about this integration and expect exponential growth in usage and penetration in this industry in the coming years.”

Existing Deribit users can create a SignalPlus account through t.signalplus.com and connect it to their Deribit account API, and new users can sign up quickly through the trading platform dashboard.

Finally, SignalPlus will airdrop special NFTs to its early backers. A commemorative NFT will be given to users that sign up for the trading platform, bind their Deribit API key, complete the signup form via the official Twitter page @SignalPlus Web3, and complete their first transaction within the promotion time. The specifics of the additional rewards and perks that the NFTs will provide holders with are currently being planned and will be disclosed soon.

item.title: Illuvium: Zero To Enter Private Alpha In January
item.dc:creator: Harold
item.description: Key Points: On January 6, 2023, Illuvium: Zero, the mobile and desktop companion to the blockchain-based RPG game Illuvium, will enter Private Alpha. Versions for Android, Windows, and MAC will be available. Illuvium keeps its playerbase excited by announcing the date for the first alpha of the game, the third game in their original three-game […]
item.content:encoded:
Key Points:

  • With the announcement of a timetable for the release of the first alpha for Illuvium: Zero, their land-owning, and management game, Illuvium keeps the alphas coming.
  • The alpha testing will likely be divided into two seasons. Currently, Season 0 is expected to run 6 to 8 weeks before being completely reset and wiping all data.
  • Season 1 of the game will follow Season 0, and it will last up until the open beta phase. At the conclusion of Season 1, another data reset is anticipated.
On January 6, 2023, Illuvium: Zero, the mobile and desktop companion to the blockchain-based RPG game Illuvium, will enter Private Alpha. Versions for Android, Windows, and MAC will be available.

Illuvium keeps its playerbase excited by announcing the date for the first alpha of the game, the third game in their original three-game series, following the recent launch of their first Overworld beta.

All land owners, past, present, and future will have access to the Illuvium: Zero Private Alpha.

The alpha testing will likely be divided into two seasons. Currently, Season 0 is expected to run 6 to 8 weeks before being completely reset and wiping off all data (even blueprints).

Season 0 is meant to give the development team a chance to fix bugs and balance problems while averting any potential problems that might occur if player data needs to be reset.

Illuvium: Zero is a game about base building, resource extraction, and blueprint creation. Players can opt to produce Fuel (which powers players in the Illuvium Overworld), materials for growth and crafting, or blueprints for NFT Overworld and Arena skins.

The game offers players a variety of tactical alternatives and judgment calls. Everything from building placement (some buildings fit together better than others), resource management, market work, and Illuvial research for blueprints are crucial decision points.

Season 1 of the game will follow Season 0, and it will last up until the open beta phase. At the conclusion of Season 1, another data reset is anticipated.

item.title: DCA Protocol Mean Finance Live On Ethereum
item.dc:creator: Harold
item.description: Key Points: The decentralized DCA (Dollar Cost Average) protocol Mean Finance is already operational on Ethereum. Users can choose the frequency at which they exchange one ERC-20 token for another. Mean Finance on Ethereum currently accepts ETH, WBTC, USDC, and DAI. Additionally, users have the option to deposit their money with Euler Finance in order […]
item.content:encoded:
Key Points:

  • Decentralized DCA protocol Mean Finance announced it’s live on Ethereum. Users can swap one ERC-20 token for another with a preferred frequency.
  • Mean Finance on Ethereum supports ETH, WBTC, USDC, and DAI. Users can also choose to invest through DCA while depositing their assets into Euler Finance to earn yields.
  • THe protocol will slowly but certainly work with intriguing projects in the near future to open up new return sources and investment opportunities.
The decentralized DCA (Dollar Cost Average) protocol Mean Finance is already operational on Ethereum. Users can choose the frequency at which they exchange one ERC-20 token for another.

Mean Finance on Ethereum currently accepts ETH, WBTC, USDC, and DAI. Additionally, users have the option to deposit their money with Euler Finance in order to earn rewards while investing through DCA.

It will slowly but certainly work with intriguing projects in the near future to open up new return sources and investment opportunities.

Mean Finance is the state-of-the-art DCA open protocol that enables users (or dApps) to DCA any ERC20 into any ERC20 with their preferred period frequency without sacrificing decentralization or giving up personal information to any centralized parties.

DCA is a tool an investor can use to build savings and wealth over a long period while neutralizing the short-term volatility in the market.

The purchases occur regardless of the asset’s price and at regular intervals. In effect, this strategy removes much of the detailed work of attempting to time the market in order to make purchases of assets at the best prices.

The protocol is designed in such a way that users get protection against volatility while market makers are well-incentivized to execute the trades.

Users can get protection against market volatility, MEV-protected trades, and gas-less DCA. Market makers can leverage the whole protocol balance to execute the trade, earn a percentage of the fees, and arbitrage the Mean Finance pool.

DISCLAIMER: The Information on this website is provided as general market commentary and does not constitute investment advice. We encourage you to do your own research before investing.
